text: examined and testified as follows:
-  -  - EXAMINATION
Can you please state your name for the record, sir.
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Sure.  Francis Stubbs, S-T-U-B-B-S.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And have you ever gone by any other names?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yes, Chip.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I represent the plaintiff, Celeste Mihalo.  Have you ever given a deposition before?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No, but I've assisted at them.  I'm an interpreter.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  What language?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Spanish.  I've actually done them right in this room.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you kind of know how this goes?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Exactly.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'll just briefly go over the instructions.
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Verbal instructions, "yes," "no," 'cause the court reporter is here and can't take it down.  If you don't understand what I'm saying, please tell me and I will rephrase.  If you don't know and you want to estimate, that's fine.  Just let me know that you're estimating. Are you under the influence today of any medications, drugs, alcohol that would affect your ability to testify truthfully?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No, I am not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What is your date of birth, sir?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: And are you married?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What is your wife's name?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Carmen, C-A-R-M-E-N.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how long have you been married?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: It will be 25 years this November.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Any children?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: One.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what's their name and age?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: David, and he is 15.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And where do you currently live, sir?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I live about a block south of here on East Oakland Avenue.  154 is the number.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long have you lived there?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: '97.  22 years, I guess.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And who do you live there with, your wife and son?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: My wife and son, uh-huh.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Does your wife also own a car?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You have a car and she has a car?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what is your highest level of education?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I have a bachelor of music.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And where did you get that degree?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Well, now it's called the University of the Arts. It wasn't called that then, but now it's U of A.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And when did you graduate?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: And you said you're currently employed as an interpreter?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I am an interpreter, and I'm also an organist in church.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Any specific church?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Addisville, A-D-D-I-S-V-I-L-L-E, Addisville Reformed Church in Richboro, PA.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And as an interpreter, who do you work for?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Various agencies and the -- Bucks County.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long have you worked as an interpreter?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: A little over ten years.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how about as an organist?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Organist, I've -- well, I've worked as an organist since I was 13, but at this church, a little -- about 10 years.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And have you ever had your license suspended or revoked?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Any kind of moving violations like speeding tickets?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I did have a speeding ticket.  Oh.  Wait a minute. That was my wife.  Wait a minute.  Oh.  I know what I -- I had a driving without -- registration was -- was expired.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know when you got that ticket approximately?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Close to ten years ago.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Any prior car accidents?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yes.  Yes.  I had one.  My brakes failed on a truck.  That was about -- I'd say about 12 years ago.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And can you just briefly tell me what happened with that accident.
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yes.  I was approaching the stop sign at Church, and -- here in town.  I think it was at Church Street. And my brakes failed, and I hit the back end of a delivery truck.  No -- no one was hurt.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Any lawsuits arise out of that?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Any other prior car accidents?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: One other accident in Camden.  I was on assignment, and I was rear-ended pulling into a gas station.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Any other prior accidents?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No, not that I can remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Any accidents after the accident we're here for today?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall being involved in this accident on September 28th, 2016?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Absolutely, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What time of day did it happen?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: It was evening, I would say around 7:00 or so.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what was the weather like?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: It was rainy and dark.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How hard was it raining?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Fairly steady.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Had it been raining all day?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I think so.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what kind of car were you driving?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I was in an E-250 cargo van, Ford.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what color was it?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: White.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you own the car?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you insure the car?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was it in good working order?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Pretty good.  It was an old van.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What year was it?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: '97, if I don't -- if I recall.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did it have a valid inspection?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And registration?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Absolutely.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: In Pennsylvania?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was anyone else in the car with you?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And where were you coming from?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I was coming from my warehouse in Trumbauersville, that's T-R-U-M-B-A-U-E-R-S, ville.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what were you doing at the warehouse?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I was helping a friend load a truck with some merchandise.  He was coming -- he was from Rhode Island.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What kind of merchandise?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I sell -- I used to have an arts and crafts import business.  It was mostly arts and crafts.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You had that business at the time of the accident?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I was still selling a little bit but just to friends.  This is a friend of mine.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you're no longer doing that?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Very occasionally.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what do you mean by like "arts and crafts"?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Well, I would travel around and buy articles of wood, iron, glass, clay all around the world, Asia, South America, Mexico, and ship them here and sell them.  I had two stores in New Hope and one here in Doylestown.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you have stores right now?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No.  I closed all my stores as of 2012.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: But you still kind of sell the arts and crafts?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: What's left over.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you said you were at the warehouse?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long were you there before you left?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I would say about four or five hours.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then, where were you going?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Home.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long does it take to get from the warehouse to home?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Roughly, 35 minutes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have to be home at any particular time?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you weren't in a rush?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No, I was not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did you have a cell phone at the time?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I do -- I did, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What was the number?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I -- I think it was (215)939-6469.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what was the provider?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: T-Mobile.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you using the cell phone in the car that day?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I -- I did use it just before this accident happened, but I had hung up before it happened.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you -- you made a phone call?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No.  My son called me, actually.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you using the phone in any other capacity, GPS, music?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No, I was not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you have to wear glasses, sir?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yes, but not to drive.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Just to read?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: For reading, uh-huh.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  So you said you left the warehouse, heading home.  How long after you left the warehouse did the accident occur?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: It was about 10, 15 minutes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what street were you on when the accident occurred?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I was on Route 313.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Are you familiar with that street?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Very.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How often do you drive on that street?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I had that building for 15 years, so often.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Every time you left that building, you went home?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I would say most of the time, I took 313, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you describe the area of Route 313 where the accident occurred.
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yes.  I was just past 5th Street, which is -- goes into Perkasie.  And it's a stretch -- I think it's 55 miles an hour there.  And it's an open stretch before you get to Dublin.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How many lanes of traffic?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Two.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: One in each direction?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You said, "The speed limit is 55 miles per hour." Do you know how fast you were going?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I was probably going 40 to 45 'cause my van was quite old.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What's on either side of the street?  Is it like a residential area?  Is it --
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Let me see.  Well, there's -- on the left, there was -- there's like a garden stand in the summer.  This wasn't summer.  But -- and there's a business and -- a couple businesses.  On the right is just open fields.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is there parking on either side of the street?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how was the traffic that day?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Fairly light.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that normal --
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yes --
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- for that area?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: -- at that hour.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Any kind of traffic control devices like a -- a light or a stop sign or --
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Where the accident happened?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yes.
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No, there's not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  And can you just briefly describe how this impact occurred.
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yeah.  I was coming down 313, heading east.  And I -- I remember seeing a car up ahead.  But as I said, it was dark and rainy.  And I just saw running lights, so I assumed the car was moving.  And it wasn't until I was almost on top of -- of Celeste Mihalo that I realized that she was stopped. And I don't remember any emergency rights -- lights or brake lights, just running lights. And I just -- I, of course, applied the brakes, but I slipped.  I mean it was skidding, and I just plowed into her tire that was on the -- she had one of those Jeeps that had the tire on the back, and I hit that tire pretty hard.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you said you did see her car.  Can you estimate time-wise?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I would say about five, six seconds before.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you said you couldn't tell if she was stopped or moving?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I could not.  I -- I assumed she was moving.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you said the only thing you saw were running lights?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: That's correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how fast would you say you thought you were going?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Well, I was probably going 40, 45 until I hit the brakes.  And then, I don't know how fast I was going when I hit her.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how soon after you saw her did you apply the brakes?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Probably about three seconds.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And can you describe the impact.
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: It was fairly strong.  My airbag inflated, and that was pretty awful.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Just your driver side airbag?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And where were you looking when the collision occurred?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Straight ahead.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you said you hit the tire on the rear of her car.  Was it completely the front of your car.  Did you hit like square on?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: The damage was more to the right-hand side of my front -- of the front of my car -- of my van.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Other than applying the brakes, did you make any other evasive maneuvers?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No.  There wasn't time.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And after the impact, did your car move at all?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I tried to move it to the -- past the bridge.  It was right at a bridge, and I tried to get it off the road because I was choking, quite honestly.  I rolled down the window and there was --
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: 'Cause of the --
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: The airbags were just -- that gunpowder, whatever they put in there was -- was choking me.  And I was putting my head out the window, trying to get it off to the side, which I managed to do.  There's a driveway just past -- at 1300 Route 13.  I managed to pull off there.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: But once -- or right at the impact, did your car hit and stay there?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Pretty much, yeah.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how about my client's car?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I think her's -- she must have been pushed forward.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did your body move at all --
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yeah.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- upon impact inside the car?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I hit that airbag pretty hard.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you sustain any damage to your car other than the -- the airbag being deployed?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: The car was -- the van was totaled.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How about my client's car, were you able to see if she had damage?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yeah.  Her -- the tire absorbed a lot of the impact.  Her battery was knocked loose, but we managed -- the police actually managed to reattach that.  And I'm sure -- I'm pretty sure she was able to drive her vehicle home.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So after the impact, you said you immediately tried to move to the side of the road?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And can you describe to me again where you were trying to move.
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I was trying to get to a driveway that was just past the bridge where the impact occurred.  And it's -- I remember the address is 1300.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And after you moved your car, what did you do next?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Well, we got -- I got out and made sure Celeste was okay, and she seemed to be.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You spoke with her?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Absolutely.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what did she say?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: She was shaken up.  She said that -- well, actually, there were two witnesses to this, which I -- I did not get their name or number.  I think they called the police though, so you might be able to get it there.  And they -- and Celeste told me a couple deer had come across the road.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever see the deer?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I did not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Are there deer commonly in that area?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that why she was stopped in the road?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Apparently, yes.  And -- and the police did remark that they saw hoof marks on the front of her car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you said there was two witnesses at the scene. Did you speak with them?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Briefly.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember what was said?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Just that they saw it all happen and that they had called the police.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And the police did arrive on scene?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: After some time, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you approximate?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I'd say a good 15 minutes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what were you doing in that 15 minutes?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I was talking to Celeste.  But then, she got on her phone and called someone.  I was just processing what had just happened.  I called my son to let him know I would be a little bit late.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you call anybody else?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what happened when the police got there?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Well, I should correct that.  Until I called a tow truck.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  What happened once the police got there?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: They examined the cars and determined that it was an accident.  No one was cited.  No tickets were issued to either of us.  And they saw the hoof marks and chalked it up as bad luck.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was a police report made?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you seen that police report?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I don't think so.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And after speaking with the police, what happened next?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I -- I called a -- a truck -- tow service through Triple A.  And I believe Celeste left with her car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: She was able to drive away from the scene?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: If I remember correctly, yes.  I'm not 100 percent sure.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you said your van was totaled, right?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: It was a total loss, yeah.  I didn't have collision.  It was so old.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And where was it towed to?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: To my mechanic here in Doylestown, over on -- near the airport.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how did you leave the scene?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: In the tow truck.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did somebody pick you up from the --
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I think I walked home from there.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Other than you, Celeste, the police officer, and the -- you said there was two witnesses?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was there anyone else on the scene?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Just the people who live at 1300.  They came sometime after the accident and just pulled in their driveway.  That was the only other people.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you speak with them?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No, not at all.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And have you ever seen any of the witnesses or my client since?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No.  No, I haven't.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long were you on the scene?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I'd say about 45 minutes to an hour.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you sustain any injuries from this accident?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Personal?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yes.
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: You mean physical?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yes.
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Yes.  I hurt my right shoulder.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you seek treatment for that injury?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I did.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Are you still currently treating?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Let me just look over this.
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: You said you -- after the impact, you moved your car to the right?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did my client ever move her car?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I don't think so.  The battery had come disconnected, so she couldn't start it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You said that the police came and -- and reattached it?
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: I remember the police helping her reattach the battery.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I think that's all I have.
speaker: MS. HUDACK

text: Okay.  Awesome.
speaker: MS. KOELSCH

text: (Witness excused.)

(Deposition ended at 9:15 a.m.) C E R T I F I C A T I O N I, Ian Monahan, Court Reporter and Notary Public of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, certify that the foregoing is a true and accurate transcript of the foregoing deposition, that the witness was first sworn by me at the time, place and on the date herein before set forth. I further certify that I am neither attorney nor counsel for, not related to nor employed by any of the parties to the action in which this deposition was taken; further, that I am not a relative or employee of any attorney or counsel employed in this case, nor am I financially interested in this action.
